poem:
Refractions of Power

In the morning,
            the headlines
tangle their threads—
            echoes of
yesterday's titans.

Boris and Brexit,
            the same old shtick,
while Britain aches,
            each promise
a splinter.

Serfdom they say,
            as history's wheel
             creaks onward,
and dawn
            finds its reflection
            in puddled
words.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Boris Johnson claims we are heading for 'serfdom' if Starmer changes our awful Brexit deal. Ignore him | Naomi Smith We are seeing a Conservative movement so bereft, so out of ideas, that it’s replaying its old hits. At the end of their reign, with Britain poorer, sicker and less free, it is unclear where the Tories go now. Still, idiocy does adore a vacuum, and so it’s time to talk about Boris Johnson again.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
